alert.note: Alert for Blount; Etowah (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 12:56PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Blount and northwestern Etowah Counties through 145 PM CDT... At 1254 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Snead, or 12 miles northeast of Oneonta, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gadsden, Rainbow City, Attalla, Sardis City, Altoona, Snead, Susan Moore, Walnut Grove, Reece City, Aurora, Gadsden Mall, Noccalula Falls, Gadsden Steam Plant, Big Wills Creek, Howelton, Crudup, Mountainboro, Keener, Rockledge and Gadsden Water Works. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for central and northeastern Alabama.
